page.title: 09A HOUSE IN EAST SUSSEX
page.content: THE HOUSE IS SET IN A RAMBLING GARDEN SURROUNDED BY WOODS. IT IS BUILT IN TWO PARTS, THE ORIGINAL DATING BACK TO 1726. THE OUTER WHITE BRICK CONCEALS WATTLE AND IS SUPPORTED BY THE ORIGINAL BEAMS WHICH ARE REPUTED TO BE OF THE SAME MATERIAL AS THE WOOD USED IN DRAKE'S NAVY. THEIR GUNS WERE BUILT WITH IRON TAKEN FROM MINES IN THE HEATHFIELD AREA AND WERE TESTED AT HORAM. THE EARLY WALL PAPER WAS HAND PAINTED IN PATTERNS OF BIRDS, FLOWERS OR ANIMALS. THE WATER SUPPLY IS TAKEN FROM STREAMS OR WELLS AND IT IS PURIFIED WITH CHLORINE. THE OCCCUPANTS DISPLAY AN INTELLIGENT INTEREST IN ALL FORMS OF NATURAL HISTORY. SOMETIMES WILD ANIMALS BECOME TAME IN THEIR GROUNDS. THEY APPRECIATE THINGS OF THE PAST ESPECIALLY OLD BUILDINGS AND FURNITURE REPRESENTATIVE OF PEOPLES' WAY OF LIFE.
